title: AI in Education & Skilling — Interactive CS Learning Platform

requirements.text: Create a visually rich, interactive dashboard as the main landing page showing the student's learning path, progress stats, and quick-access cards for each module (Architectural Logic, Data Structures, System Design, Git Mastery). Use a dark-tech aesthetic with accent neon highlights, bold typography, and animated progress indicators.

quotes: give interactive frontend side which is better to see

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard renders module cards with title, short description, and progress percentage
Animated progress bars or ring charts reflect completion state
Navigation between modules is accessible from the dashboard
Layout is responsive across desktop and tablet viewports

requirements.text: Build an interactive Data Structure Visualizer module that lets students compare algorithmic approaches side-by-side (e.g., BST vs flat array search). Animate step-by-step traversal with highlighted nodes/elements, display time complexity callouts, and explain with contextual 'why this matters in industry' tooltips.

quotes: why a specific approach (like using a Binary Search Tree over a flat array
Current learning platforms act as simple auto-graders, failing to teach students why

acceptanceCriteria: Student can select two data structures to compare from a dropdown
Animated step-by-step traversal runs on a sample dataset
Big-O complexity labels are shown for each approach
Industry context tooltip explains a real-world scenario where the preferred approach wins
A 'Run comparison' button triggers the animation

requirements.text: Build an AI Mentor panel that displays contextual explanations for any code problem or architectural decision. The mentor responds with 'why' reasoning (not just correctness), structured as: Approach Chosen → Trade-offs → Real-world Analogy → Better Alternative (if any). Mentor responses are stored in the backend and retrieved per session.

quotes: failing to teach students why a specific approach

acceptanceCriteria: Mentor panel is accessible from every module page
Student can type a question or paste a code snippet
Response renders in a structured card with the four sections (Approach, Trade-offs, Analogy, Alternative)
Mentor responses are saved to the backend and can be revisited in a 'My Notes' history list
Loading state with animated thinking indicator is shown while response is being fetched

requirements.text: Build a Git Conflict Resolution Simulator module. Present the student with a realistic merge conflict scenario (base, ours, theirs versions shown in a split diff editor). Student resolves the conflict by editing the merged output. The system validates the resolution and provides step-by-step guided hints if the student is stuck.

quotes: Current learning platforms act as simple auto-graders

acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 pre-loaded conflict scenarios are available (simple variable rename, logic divergence, structural refactor)
Three-panel diff view shows base, ours, and theirs side by side
Editable merged output panel lets the student resolve the conflict
A 'Check Resolution' button validates the student's answer against the expected output stored in the backend
Hints are revealed progressively (up to 3 levels) when the student requests help
Success state shows a congratulation banner with an explanation of the correct resolution

requirements.text: Build an Industry Challenge Feed that lists real-world system design and architectural tasks (e.g., 'Design a URL shortener', 'Choose the right DB for a ride-sharing app'). Each challenge card shows difficulty, estimated time, and a 'Start Challenge' CTA. Challenges are stored and retrieved from the backend.

quotes: Industry-aligned challenge feed with real-world scenarios and system design tasks
lack the environment to practice architectural logic, problem-solving, and practical system design

acceptanceCriteria: Challenge feed shows a scrollable list of at least 6 pre-seeded challenges
Each card displays title, category tag, difficulty badge (Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced), and estimated time
Clicking 'Start Challenge' opens a full-screen challenge workspace with a problem statement and a free-form answer editor
Submitted answers are saved to the backend linked to the student's session
Challenges can be filtered by category or difficulty on the frontend

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive dark-tech visual theme across the entire application: deep charcoal/near-black backgrounds, electric green and cyan neon accents, monospace + sans-serif font pairing, subtle grid or circuit-pattern backgrounds, glowing card borders on hover, and smooth page transition animations. The design should feel like a professional developer IDE meets a learning platform.

quotes: give interactive frontend side which is better to see

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share the same dark background and accent color tokens via Tailwind config
Card hover states include a glowing border effect
Typography uses a monospace font for code/technical content and a clean sans-serif for body text
Smooth CSS transitions are applied to route changes and interactive elements
No page uses a white or light background

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo)
Do not integrate any external AI API — mentor responses and challenge hints must be pre-authored or rule-based within the backend
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
No external databases — all data persisted in Motoko stable variables
nonGoals: Real-time collaborative coding or WebSocket-based features
User authentication or Internet Identity integration in this iteration
Mobile native app or React Native implementation
Integration with third-party LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
Automated code execution or sandboxed code runner

required: Dark hero banner with circuit board pattern, glowing nodes, and subtle neon green grid lines (hero-banner.dim_1400x400.png)
Minimalist neon-green brain-chip icon on dark background (logo-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Abstract dark background texture with faint hexagonal grid pattern in deep charcoal (bg-texture.dim_1920x1080.png)
